extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium green pepper, cut into rings

extendedIngredients.name: pork loin chops
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 bone-in pork loin chops (3/4-inch thick and 8 ounces each)

recipes.title: Pork Chops Italiano

winePairing.pairingText: Pork Chops works really well with Riesling, Chardonnay, and Pinot Noir. Chardonnay suits simple chops or chops in a butter or cream sauce, dry riesling complements sweet additions like honey mustard or apples, and pinot noir is a safe bet for pork dishes in general. One wine you could try is Poet's Leap Riesling. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Poet's Leap Riesling
productMatches.description: Key lime and fresh citrus peel aromas give way to vivid layers of white peach and stone fruit flavors accented by a pleasant touch of minerality. Delicious natural acidity and a hint of residual sugar provide a balanced, vibrant mouth-feel and lengthy finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Sprinkle pork chops with pepper. In a large skillet, brown chops in butter on both sides; drain. Combine the tomato sauce, water, Italian seasoning and basil; pour over chops. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 6-8 minutes or until meat juices run clear.                                                                                           Top each pork chop with cheese and green pepper. Cover and cook 3-5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Pork Chops Italiano in  Quick CookingJanuary/February 2005, p14                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 each) equals 211 calories, 13 g fat (8 g saturated fat), 55 mg cholesterol, 486 mg sodium, 6 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 18 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Sprinkle pork chops with pepper. In a large skillet, brown chops in butter on both sides; drain.
Combine the tomato sauce, water, Italian seasoning and basil; pour over chops. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 6-8 minutes or until meat juices run clear.
Top each pork chop with cheese and green pepper. Cover and cook 3-5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
